intro: Hieracium aestivum subsp. subumbellatiforme, commonly known as the summer hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by petal-like rays, and it produces small, oval-shaped achenes as fruits. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
